verb.description: Cause air to enter and circulate freely in (a room, building, etc.)
examples: gas heaters should only ever be used in well-ventilated rooms

verb.description: Discuss or examine (an opinion, issue, or complaint) in public.
examples: he used the club to ventilate an ongoing complaint

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense winnow, scatter): from Latin ventilat- blown, winnowed, from the verb ventilare, from ventus wind. Sense 1 dates from the mid 18th century.
